captions.text: Turn in, slide a bit
Give the car a correction. Acceleration.

I like my job, driving all day
on the Nordschleife in the ring taxi.
It's really fun to scare people.

They love to get scared,
so they pay me for that.
But it's a good job.
I do what I want to do.
NÜRBURG, GERMANY
I grew up in my mom's hotel

in the middle
of that little village Nürburg.

There were not many hotels
at that time around the track.
And all the former Grand Prix drivers
like Ascari, they were in our hotel.
And later, Nelson Piquet.
So, very famous people came.

So, I was always interested
in motor racing.

When I was 13 years old, I decided
I wanted to be a racing driver.

When I was 17 years old,
I did my first lap in my mom's BMW.
And she didn't know that, for sure.

And the guys on the track,
we had just a person there.

You had the ticket, you show
him the ticket and then you could go.

He said: "Oh, Sabine, you are 18?
You've got your driving license?"

I said: "Oh, yes! Bye-bye."
Vroom.
And then I would go on the track.
Are you still alive?

When I was young,
I was always fast on roller skates,
with the bicycle, you know.

It doesn't matter what,
but it had to be fast.

So, I had the fastest horse
around in the surroundings.

I never played with Barbie
or with the girls.
I always liked to play football.
And I was always interested in machines.
I think with BMW I have won...
45 races on the Nordschleife.
The M5...

You know,
it's like I am a part of the car.
I know the car so well.
I have been driving the M5

for 17 years or 18 years
as a ring taxi.

I just walk in,
close the door and it's one thing.

I don't know,
it's my home, my living room, the M5.
And it's really fun to drive.

-Oh, my God!
-Wow. My God.
Faster!

My name is Sabine Schmitz, and the
people call me the "Queen of the Ring"

or "the fastest taxi driver
in the world".

You know, for me it's like
the way to school every morning.

I never had to learn the track.
It's... I don't know, it's in my blood.
UNSCRIPTED

comments.author: MacClay8

comments.text:
+Phil Oh no, someone was sarcastic in a YouTube comments section!  Truly a 
grievous internet crime!

Listen Champ, I'll explain.  Sabine Schmitz has an Awesome Job.  So awesome 
in fact, that it eclipses pretty much every other job beyond Astronaut, 
Child of Wealthy Parents, or Successful Musician in terms of job 
satisfaction/bullshit ratio.  She is not alone in this distinction, but her 
situation is extremely abnormal. 

Since the job openings for these or similar jobs are so few in comparison 
to even qualified applicants, you can rarely even actually apply for them. 
 Hence my sarcastic reply to your implication that the only factor 
preventing anyone from having an equally awesome job is that they hadn't 
applied for one yet.  

My "bullshit government job" isn't actually bad at all, it just is in 
COMPARISON to getting paid to drive around on the Nurburgring.  It's not 
specifically enjoyable, so much as it is tolerable while paying well enough 
to do actually enjoyable things outside of work.  I'll assume by your 
profile picture that you are a car guy, and I don't need to explain this 
concept further.  While I freely admit that I am lazy, my self-esteem 
doesn't factor in to it.

You are technically correct though, there's nothing actually preventing me 
from applying for these jobs when they are posted, I'd just have to do so 
with the understanding that I wouldn't be successful in obtaining one. 
 There are a lot of
